author: victorcorcino
title: Community Advisor Improvements
description: Community Advisors are an evolving key role of Project Catalyst and need a place and budget to submit proposals to improve their performance

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge allows us to allocate resources to improve all the tools, methods and systems associated with this important role for the Catalyst community. So from that logic it is perfectly aligned with Cardano's mission and meets the metric that seeks to prepare people who are willing to make contributions to the ecosystem. More and more people are interested in contributing to the community through this role so it makes sense to me that this challenge helps us to strengthen it. So I agree in terms of alignment.
f6_assessments.q1: During fund 8 is the first time we had this challenge, and although it was a budget of only $100,000, only 12 proposals were submitted to compete for these funds. I would have expected a greater response from the community but that was not the case. This time the challenge team is requesting a 50% increase in budget, so considering the amount of proposals submitted I must admit that I am not entirely sure that we can respond as expected and avoid allocating funds inefficiently.
f6_assessments.q2: I expected nothing less from the challenge team. It presents a set of suggested metrics with the right focus which are simple to best enable potential proposers. They are also relatively easy to measure and plot which also makes it easier for the community to do auditing exercises. Congratulations! My score is 5.

f6_assessments.q0:
Project Catalyst has been running for over 1.5 years now and the role that (v)CA's play have grown over time. By the looks of it, the roles will continue to be an integral part of the system. In order to achieve a more inclusive and democratic system we need tools to make the process more available and efficient so that we can onboard and recruit people from all over the world. The authors of the proposal does a good job of explaining why CA's and vCA's play a key role in the Project Catalyst ecosystem. 

The 'Community Advisor Improvements' challenge setting is currently present in Fund 8 and this proposal is requesting for it to be present in the upcoming Fund 9 as well. The slight addition is an increased budget by 50% (150k vs 100k). 
Increasing the budget for this necessary challenge setting seems like a natural transition since the community has had time to develop ideas. Also, proposals from Fund 8 that did not succeed to receive funding can review their ideas and proposals from the feedback received in Fund 8 and apply again. Additionally, this leaves room for successful projects to remain maintained (with help of funding) as well as funding new and exciting proposals.

With the above mentioned arguments, it is safe to say that this proposal aligns with Cardano's mission and the Fund 9 strategic goals. Score given: 5-stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Ca and vCA community have proved themselves before a dedicated "Community Advisor Improvements" challenge setting existed by developing tools and compiling data/info. There is not much more evidence needed since there is real proof of delivery already. It would however be interesting to re-evaluate this topic once the funded proposals in Fund 8 have delivered their projects.
The feasibility of this challenge setting is rated the highest possible: 5-stars.
f6_assessments.q2:
The key metrics suggested to measure progress is sufficient and enough. In my opinion, all relatively easy to measure except the last. There might be something I'm missing but "Number of out of the box ideas" is a very general metric without a clear definition it seems, almost indicating it is subjective. It is hard to take a stand either for or against it and the score given will remain neutral against that metric. All in all, the metrics presented are sufficient enough to audit 
success within the challenge. Score given: 5-stars.

f6_assessments.q0: Given the trust the community places in CA tools and to improve accountability and transparency this challenge should be emphasizing open source solutions which would also help it align with the Fund 9 Strategic goals. Overall improving the (v)CA tools and processes is good way to advance Cardano's mission as there is plenty of room for improvement.
f6_assessments.q1: Investing approximately 1% of the total funds into improving the process that influences which proposals gets funded is well within the Catalyst budget capacity without any significant impact. Tools might fall under other challenges however assessment processes and reputation models would likely be unique to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are adequate but not particularly inspired. Defining success and metrics beyond the number of proposals of various types would be beneficial.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge falls within Cardano's mission. It is a challenge about making improvements to being a CA. By improving the work for a CA you provide the group that helps the ecosystem do a better job, which in terms help the ecosystem more. Everyone can make a proposal in the challenge settings which makes it 100% open-source. 
As I am a CA myself for the past few funds I've seen immense growth in the system but we can still use an extra boost. 
I fully agree with this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Because this is a recurring challenge we can look at past funds to see how the community addresses this challenge and we've seen some really good proposals in this challenge. The team behind the proposal is positively known within the CA community and has proven its worth.
f6_assessments.q2:
Key metrics are in line with the challenge and success of it. Since we are here for improvements on the system the challenge briefing could also use some improvements. Personally, I would some more metrics.
impact of the tools being developed.
percentage of usage of the tool.

f6_assessments.q0: Improvement is a great factor in every productivity mechanism and especially in the case of CAs and VCAs who play a key role in ensuring proposals are in good shape to possibly attain funds to perform developmental projects in societies and the entire cardano ecosystem needs a face lift, I therefore think it's very important to be considered as it will go a long way to help the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility aspect of this proposal is clearly understandable because it aims at accelerating the general work of the key players and I think the community should take into way forward plans.
f6_assessments.q2: Increasment in number of new tools for development,new mechanism for assessing and scoring proposals,number of maintenance proposals and groups created and number of out of the box ideas by CAs and VCAs are all qualities that will determine the follow up  journey of this proposal successfully.

f6_assessments.q0: CA's are our first line of defense. This proposal must always be up. We have seen first hand how people are abusing the system. I have not gone through the proposals submitted in this Challenge, but I highly hope someone addresses the needs of a reputation system of being a CA. This is where this Challenge will accelerate all these efforts, knowing there are clearly pooled funds. I am certain we have been infiltrated by individuals that have observed us, try to exploit are "kindness" or "decentralized" nature. And I feel there is a coordination between these individuals, where one becomes the ring leader and takes the most risk while one plays the role of manipulation. I believe also people are creating fakes persona's, but their method of writing gives them away. I also believe people are falsifying their relations with their so-called team members. They are intentionally using their links with out their permission. It's getting crazy and I will do all I can to support this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Fortunately the core founders or the core team of Community Advisors are true. Which gives hope that future improvements will happen and must happen. I have also seen the influx of tools being introduced into our ecosystem, tools that addresses identity, that addresses transparency. Although it is still initially used within the smaller Cardano communities, through proposer reporting and engagement, these systems has and hopefully continuously be exposed the to Community Advisor and Veteran Community Advisor team.
f6_assessments.q2: It is again reassuring the proposer has identified that success criteria for this Challenge is a solution that comes from the community as a team. For having it come from a team, would suggest this solution represents the whole. Though perhaps, there are those special in-tune individuals that can materialize solutions from unique observations that might not be thought off by the community should also be considered. This is indeed a balancing act, because if we are not united in a solution, we might not perform effectively as a whole.

f6_assessments.q0: I gave this challenge a 3 of 5 for the following reasons. I think it is important to refine the ca process but i am not sure we have enough data to start refining and changing the ca process. we are still now just starting to onboard more talent in our community and i think projects and eauntrapreneurs havnts fully used or tested the catalyst system to the extent it was made for. similarly, i don't think talented potential ca's or vca's or other catalyst rolls have filled up or have been onboarded just yet. So i think it is something we should think about but I'm not convinced it is the priority at this point in time as we still onboard talent and competent people to lube the system that is already in place !
f6_assessments.q1: Feasibility is a 3 of 5 for me as well because of my previous statements. I don't know if it is wise to start making changes before we get more data and see how projects and ca's do from the system that is already in place on a longer time frame. It may be more wise to save these revisions for a future fund and focus on funding development, marketing, and legislative relations right now. So in terms of if it is feasible to make helpful changes to the community advisor system it feels a little subjective. I would have liked to see some data showing why the ca's system needs revisions for example if a project that got funded ended up scamming people and was funded because the ca's exploited the system. or even if they could have given an example of why it would be easy to improve the ca system that is in place.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the metrics were there to track the changes but there's not enough IMO on metrics showing why changes need to be made. Thus I'm not sold on what would make this challenge a successful improvement and how we could even measure that.

f6_assessments.q0: As a community advisor since Fund 5 I probably can only have a biased opinion on this challenge proposal. This challenge is critical for Catalyst mission as the number of proposal is growing rapidly. And making Catalyst Project more efficient is critical for Cardano, to enable a steady growth of developer and app eco system (Fund 9 strategic goal #3). This challenge does match with Strategice goal #1, as it aims at gathering willing CAs to make proposals.
f6_assessments.q1:
Directions are given to help group of CA to start identifying ideas, that will hopefully become projects.
Debates among community advisors on our telegram channel during assessment phase have been intense, and many people here are making proposals already. If this challenge is set, these proposals could be submitted to voters and some of them could be voted. I am sure that the community has the capacity to address this challenge, it has already been proven by the many tools developed and intense debates we had about how to improve the quality and efficiency of our work.
f6_assessments.q2: Good metrics are proposed to measure the progress of this challenge. The most tangible is the number of new tools, but I agree that measuring also number of original ideas is important to assess the progress of CA performance improvement.

f6_assessments.q0: The role of CAs and vCAs during this current governance phace cannot be taken lightly, as they assess proposals, provide feedback to proposers for improvement, and support voters and the general community on deciding which proposals are more ready and have higher chances of being successful and impact the Cardano ecosystem. Therefore, it is only logical that they, as pillars of the governance process, can use their work to suggest improvements to the overall process which will generate positive loops in the whole proposer-advisor-voter relationship and streamline the entire operation.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are two of the most active Community members in Catalyst, and key pillars of the community, generating new ideas and participating in multiple community events, be they Swarm or Town Halls, on a regular basis (even daily!). In this regard, there can be no doubt as to the experience and energy they bring to the table, and will no doubt constitute an excellent Challenge team for the (v)CA proposers who wish to enhance the general Catalyst experience.
f6_assessments.q2: The development between Funds of the (v)CA experience and requirements shows that improvements and changes to the participation and assessment exercises are almost immediately visible from one Fund to the next. Therefore, the KPIs chosen (number of new tools developed, new mechanisms for assessing and scoring proposals, maintenance proposals and groups created, etc.), alongisde the potential directions in terms of reputation and remuneration schemes, will surely be clearly verifiable and auditable by the Community, specially by the very same (v)CAs that will hopefully benefit from their colleagues´ funded proposals.

importance: Community Advisors are facing constantly challenges but dont have the possibility to actively co-design their acitivity.
success: Community Advisors (CAs) submitting proposals as a Team to improve the CAs performance, activity and evolution.
